question:
You have had a problem with your next-door neighbour. You have not been able to speak to your neighbour about this. Write a letter to this neighbour. In you letter
- explain the problem
- suggest a solution
- say what action you will take if the situation does not improve.
text: I hope you are fine .I am writing this letter as it's been more than a month that I am not able to talk to you in person.Since our official timings do not  allow us to speak because of the mismatching of our timings. However, this time I will not let our shifting duties hinder the issue. Therefore, bringing the car parking issue to your knowledge.arose last month when your driver parked the car just outside my main gate.

As your kind self knew that I have to drop my son sharp 7.00AM for school. Firstly,The driver parked the car that made him late for school. However, the problem does not finish here, despite instructing him a couple of times he still parks the vehicle at the same spot.However, I first told him politely even though I scolded him later but he seems to put his ear on air.

Thus, it's my humble request to guide him accordingly.If he doesn't behave himself.Moreover,there is a huge car parking area just at the corner of the road.Everyone parks their vehicle there .And If I find him standing in front of my vicinity again I will launch a complaint against him formally to the local council.
I hope you will solve this matter as our neighbourhood is quite old ,Although I know you will keep your words this time as you use to with.
